title: Behaviroal Health Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at WestCare (Las Vegas, NV) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a good experience and I was at ease. I felt very welcomed. I am excited to work here and help those whom need it and to form good work relationship with all.
Interview Questions: How do I feel about the job offered?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WestCare
Interview Descriptions: List of practical questions that are relevant to job? What would you do to promote the services at the agency? What are your best traits? What are the traits that could use improvement
Interview Questions: How would you handle an issue with co workers

title: Substance Abuse Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at WestCare (Bullhead City, AZ) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Ms. Debatt was warm, knowledeable and asked in-depth questions regarding my experience and education. She spent a lot of time making sure that we both were satisifed that the job was a good fit. It was a great interview.
Interview Questions: She asked me about my comfort level with a variety of skill sets and client populations. I thought this was a valuable conversation to insure that the candidate (me) fully understood the scope of services offered at this location.

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at WestCare (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Forty-Five Minute interview on zoom. Talked about the position, asked questions about what qualifications, I have for the job. Very nice and friendly people.  Asked great questions and explained the job well.
Interview Questions: How would I handle setting boundaries with clients?

title: Behavioral Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at WestCare (Las Vegas, NV) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was amazing the gentlemen that interviewed me was very honest about the position and what it entailed. I really thought the process was thought-provoking and gave me the opportunity to use my educational knowledge in an interview setting.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where a client was/is angry and coming at you in an aggressive manner?

title: Substance Abuse Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at WestCare (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively quick.  I went from a phone screen, to an interview, to being offered a job on the spot.  The interviewers asked some really thought provoking questions, some of which were your standard interview questions, but others to really get to know me not only as a candidate but a person as well.
Interview Questions: What makes you the best candidate for this job?

title: Prevention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WestCare
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long. I met with the program coordinator and the VP at the time. We went through pages of basic interview questions. There wasn't much of a natural flow of conversation but it didn't seem like that mattered.
Interview Questions: Have you had any experience working with at-risk populations, explain.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WestCare
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview process. The process does take around 2-3 weeks for completion. Extra time if you are for a specialized position. During COVID all interviews were virtual. Two interviews total
Interview Questions: Why did you choose WestCare

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WestCare
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly simple. It consisted of one interview. I expected a follow up interview but that did not happen. Some time after the interview, I received a job offer.
Interview Questions: Do you believe that addiction is a disease or a choice?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WestCare
Interview Descriptions: The President of the company asked me what it was I did at my present job?  Describe a typical day and include challenges and obstacles and nuances and explain the process in detail on how you were able to accomplish them?
Interview Questions: Explain briefly what you currently do

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at WestCare in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty straightforward and took about a month altogether. First, I met with a Senior HR leader and discussed the position, WestCare, and my experience. A week or two later, I met with two other executive leaders to discuss my qualifications further. A week later, I was offered three position.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an internal investigation?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at WestCare (Miami, FL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were relatively simple. The initial interview was by phone, where the woman described the program to which they were hiring for, asked me to give more details about my current research experience, and then proceeded to tell me that I was "the perfect candidate that they have been looking for" and immediately put me in contact with the second interviewer. I received a call from the second woman later that same day and she scheduled me for a face interview for the following week. The second lady asked me a few more job specific questions like "if I would be comfortable contacting and meeting with participants in their home", and if I spoke another language. At the end of the interview (which lasted only like 20 minutes or less), she told me that she was pleased with my credentials and would be contacting me in the following week with a hiring decisions as I was "the last one to be interviewed for the position". It has been almost 3 weeks since my interview and I have yet to hear from them, which is a shame as I really wanted this position, but have gotten another job offer since then and took it.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about going to the homes of the participant's to conduct assessments for the study?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at WestCare (Miami, FL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with the director of the program.  After that a face-to-face interview took place with supervisors at the location.  I emailed the interviewer that the position was not for me and the interviewer responded that there was a position opening soon that would be more relevant.  I expressed interest in that position and emailed twice with no response from them.  Disappointing communication indicative of how the company runs.
Interview Questions: How do you handle working with a deadline?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WestCare (Reno, NV)
Interview Descriptions: One of the interviewers was absolutely unprofessional. Yawning and checking their phone whilst interviewing. Towards the end of the interview when it was my turn to ask the company the questions , i was given the responses in an unprofessional manner.
Interview Questions: What are your three strengths and which one do you find hard to accomplish

title: Certified Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WestCare
Interview Descriptions: It was a one on one interview process. The application process was extremely long. The interview was your normal interview questions, weaknesses, times I've made mistakes, etc.  It wasn't that bad and I received a tour right after.
Interview Questions: Mistakes I've made clinically and how I dealt with it

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WestCare
Interview Descriptions: Interview took abot 15 to 30 minutes. The staffs are very friendly. It was a one to one interview. They ask you to bring in a copy of your resume and any certificate that you have.
Interview Questions: On a scale 1 to 10 how great is your Microsoft Excel skill, and why?

title: Behavioral Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WestCare (Carrollton, GA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I entered a room with the regional CEO and the director of this location and they took turns asking me questions relating to the field and the job.  The interview was laid back.
Interview Questions: How long have you been in this field?

title: Rab Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at WestCare (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my previous work experience and how I could contribute to the company and why would I want to work for the company, what qualities I have to set me higher than other candidates.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult situation?

title: Substance Abuse Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at WestCare
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward interview. The interviewer made sure I was relaxed and it flowed smoothly like an average conversation. The background check was the longest and hardest part of the process. Just a lot of waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you helped a coworker

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at WestCare (Knoxville, TN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with LCSW and other e counselor and then HR representative. Was given scenarios to solve and I emailed mine back home. The the coordinator called me back in for second interview.
Interview Questions: Why I thought I was a good Fit? What was my experience? What would I’d if someone I know came and I stated I was in’s.

title: MHT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at WestCare (Las Vegas, NV) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Scripted abviously. Nothing really hard just a bunch of personal questions to gauge your ethics and "what if scenarios". Interview team consisted of a manager and senior staff? Time from application to interview was about 2 weeks. The site I applied on was very hard to understand or input anything so I recommend bringing a resume.
Interview Questions: What was a time when one of your values was compromised and how did you respond.

title: Counselor II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at WestCare (Las Vegas, NV) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Takes a long time to get a call. They hold 3 different interviews. The process included  drug test finger printing back ground check.'the team seamed very unorganized and unprepared. The director walked in late and the left half way through as her phone rang.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you look in supervisor.

title: Substance Abuse Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at WestCare (Sheridan, IL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with whom I know as an Assistant Director. I was extremely nervous and he made me very comfortable as soon as we sat down to start the first question. He told me to relax and take a deep breath and let go and just be myself, followed with a friendly smile.  I did just that and had an enjoyable interview.
Interview Questions: What is your belief on Uplifting others?  Then share a time you demonstrated that and the outcome ( not exact wording but concept).

title: Veteran Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at WestCare (Fresno, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went well. Very professional staff. Questions were very basic and easy to answer.  Only con was I t took them 3 months to officially hire the position. The job I was hired for at Hanford office had to be the worst working experience I've ever had.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with community resources?

title: Mental Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at WestCare (Las Vegas, NV)
Interview Descriptions: I filled out a basic application in person, and was called for an interview a week later. The interview was pretty straightforward and average. When I was called in the head of the department only had a few basic questions about experience level and qualifications. Pay was not negotiable, but I was assured there would be scheduled increases for the length of time I worked there. Overall it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years.

title: Substance Abuse Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at WestCare
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 interviews. all were within the same day. they interviewed me from a book using a script. It took a total of 2 1/2 months to get a job offer. I had to do the background check, drug test, etc. It took forever to get the drug test resutls back.
Interview Questions: it was an easy interview.

title: Drug Court Counselor and CADC11 and HIV Prevention Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at WestCare (Cobb, GA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Brief connected with manager took a test and I was in, talked on phone waited many days for drug screen to come back did drug screen and background check+ had to provide  transripts overall process was good nice facility knowledgeable staff and helped me along the way, asked if I would Volunteer and I did to help 3 other departments out. Overall experience of interview was good!.
